answers.answer: Individuals arriving in Suceava can find information on how to manage in the city, including important contacts, options for temporary protection, transportation, medical services, psychological support, education, and various support organizations.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Immigration Office of Suceava County can be contacted via email at sv.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0230 203 290, 0230 203 291, 0230 203 293, 0230 203 294, or 0230 203 295.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: Individuals can register for temporary protection in Suceava County at the CRCPSA (Regional Center for Accommodation and Procedures for Asylum Seekers) Rădăuți and the Immigration Office of Suceava County.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Temporary protection in Suceava county'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian refugees in Suceava can benefit from a free travel subscription for local public transport.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: The Suceava Emergency Hospital provides general medical services, and its Pediatric Department is available for children's medical needs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Individuals can receive psychological support from several organizations, including World Vision Romania, Positive Progress psychological Solutions, Terre des hommes Foundation, Plan International Organization, and Save the Children.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: World Vision Romania and Save the Children offer psychological assistance in Russian and Ukrainian languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Several schools in Suceava county offer education with Ukrainian language teaching, including Breaza High School, Moldova Sulița High School, Izvoarele Sucevei Secondary School "Ion Aflorei", Ulma High School, Brodina High School, Bogdan Vodă High School, "Mihail Sadoveanu" High School, Lațcu Vodă Technical College, Petru Mușat High School, Baineț High School, Bălcăuti High School, Calafindești High School, Şerbăuţi High School, Măriței High School, Mihai Eminescu Suceava National College, Vatra Moldoviței High School, and Vasile Cocea Moldovița Technological High School.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Individuals can find support from organizations in Suceava by exploring a map of service providers near them.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: In Suceava, eLiberare and AMURTEL offer material support and vouchers, while in Rădăuți, JRS provides these types of assistance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Individuals can get assistance with the translation of documents and diplomas from the ICAR Foundation and CNRR.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Bucovina Institute Association offers diagnosis, evaluation, counseling, material support, support services, facilitated access to resources for vulnerable refugees, and Romanian and English language courses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Save the Children provides direct services at the Siret border transit point, Siret mobile camp, Rădăuți mobile camp, and Rădăuţi Asylum Center, and offers educational activities like summer schools, after-school, and Romanian language courses at Filadelfia High School and Ștefan cel Mare High School.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The Sensiblu Foundation offers social counseling, face-to-face or online psychotherapy, legal advice and court representation, a support network for women and girls, assistance with forensic medical certificates, and referrals to mediation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Women can access support for reproductive health services, navigation of the health system, or services for victims of domestic violence through the Women's Center section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV in Romania can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers and with the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-suceava and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
